WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the force and mass of the moon hitting you right in the boney part of your forehead. Whomp! It sure would hurt.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Outer space is cold, and if you're traveling to the moon, you're going to need a lot of coats („Åì„Å§). All of these coats will keep you warm, even if you do end up breaking your forehead bone.

origin_of_ch_char_book: What was the funeral like 3000 years ago? In ancient times, only high class people were able to use coffins. (Ê≠ª, si=ssu, death) implies a kneeling person , and to his left are the bones ( È™®, gu, bone). Back then, when a person died, they would take the corpse into the open field for some time and then come back to collect the bones. The picture shows a man mourning before the bones of a dead one. In ancient China, funerals were considered ‚Äúbad luck‚Äù and when a person died, they took the corpse to a field far away. The ancient book ‚ÄúZhou Yi‚Äù says that: ‚ÄúThe funeral ceremony of olden times consisted of dressing the corpse in thick clothes and covering it with branches and hiding it in a field. It was not a burial and there was not a tombstone.‚Äù
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The Warring States text is added with " flesh " as a sign.

Oracle is used as names of people and places. Bronze writing is used as a person's name.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to express bones, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Legal Questions and Answers" Jan. 75: "Fighting and breaking the spine" means that the neck spine is broken by fighting. It also means " pass ", which means too much, "Shangbo Zhushu VI. In the words of "Simplified 17": "Convergence is not bone (over), and it cannot be violated (exhibition)", which means that convergence is not excessive, and development cannot be deviated. Convergence and exhibition are restricted, and movement is not free (Dong Shan). Han silk script is also used as the original meaning, "Mawangdui silk script. "Ten Questions" line 80: "Strengthen the bones and muscles". "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 200th line of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Break and Blood".

"Shuowen": "Bone, the core of flesh. From ÂÜé there is meat. All bones are from the bone."
humanum_short_description_en: The shape supported by the skeleton of the inscription on the inscriptions (Yu Shengwu ). It is officially designated as "ÂÜé", which is the first text of " Bone ".

The hard tissues in the body of humans and animals that support the body to protect the internal organs: bones. Skeleton (general term for the bones of the whole body). joint. Bone and flesh (a. Refers to the closest person with blood relationship, also known as "bone and blood"; b. Yu is closely connected and inseparable relationship). Backbone (g Âàµ).
Something like bones (referring to the skeleton that supports objects): Umbrella bones. Fan bone.
Refers to the theory and pen strength of literary works: bone strength (a. vigorous pen strength; b. strong and unyielding spirit). Vigor (classical literary theory term, refers to the artistic style of the article, but also refers to the marrow of Fengshen in the work).
Refers to the quality and spirit of a person: chivalrous. backbone.

(1) Bones, the hard tissues in humans and vertebrates that support the body and protect the internal organs.
(2) Refers to the bones.
(3) Refers to the body.
(4) Especially the thin body.
(5) Refers to the animal body, the bone and flesh used in ancient sacrifices and banquets.
(6) The shelf that plays a supporting role in the object.
(7) The extension refers to the components that play a major or basic role in the overall.
(8) Refers to the root of the tree.
(9) Refers to texture; quality.
(10) Refers to substance, inside.
(11) Refers to the bones or temperament of a person.
(12) Refers to nature and character.
(13) Refers to mind, mind.
(14) Refers to the strong and vigorous pen strength of the writing.
(15) Refers to the rationale and momentum of poetry.
(16) It is a metaphor for the deep heart.
(17) The dissatisfaction and irony implied in the metaphor.
(18) Unconsciously. Shang, also.
(19) The ancient Xinluo tribe was a system of classifying according to the bloodlines of the royal family and aristocracy. Namely bone product system. Different bone grades cannot be married, and bone grades remain the same.
(20) The "cut" of timing. The transliteration of quarter.
(21) Through "slip". disturb.
(22) Last name. There were bone rituals in the Sui Dynasty. See the biography of "Sui Shu".
